original: Alkman, Olof Efraim, apotekare, Norrköping, f. 17/8/72 i Gällersta, Örebro L, av lantbr. Per Larsson o. Johanna Svensson. G. 06 m. Elsa Ahlström. Barn: Inga f. 16. — Farm. kand. 94, apot:ex. 99, stud. bakteriol. v. Köpenhamns univ. 10. Stud :res. i olika länder. Tjg. v. apot. i Härnösand 95-97, Fläkta Örn i Malmö 99-06, Eslöv (förest.) 06-20, priv. å apot. i Teckomatorp 20-27, transp. t. Kronan i Norrköp. 27-39. Led. av centr :styr. f. Sv. farm:förb. 04-10, ordf. i dess sydsv. krets 07-15, i dess fullm. 10-20, avtalsdeleg. ett 20-tal år fr. 13, fullm. i apot:kårens pens :kassa 09-39, styr:-led. o. ordf. i Östg :-kretsen av Sv. apot:förb. 31-38, led. av dess verkst. utsk. 27-34, led. av o. v. ordf. i dess centr :styr. 35-39, led. av apot. avgifts-beredn. 28-35, apot. befordr:nd 30-39, led. av stadsfullm. i Eslöv 11-20. Föredragshåll. v. farmac :möten. Skr.: art. i farm. löne- o. avtalsfrågor. Hobby: saml. av företr :vis modern, svensk konst. RVO.
translated: Alkman, Olof Efraim, pharmacist, Norrköping, born August 17th, 1872 in Gällersta, Örebro County, to farmer Per Larsson and Johanna Svensson. Married in 1906 to Elsa Ahlström, with one child, Inga, born in 1916. Received a degree in pharmacy in 1894 and passed the pharmacist exam in 1899. Studied bacteriology at the University of Copenhagen in 1910 and did study trips in various countries. Worked as a temporary pharmacist in Härnösand from 1895-1897, at Fläkta Örn in Malmö from 1899-1906, as the supervisor at Eslöv from 1906-1920 and privately at a pharmacy in Teckomatorp from 1920-1927 until transferring to Kronan in Norrköping from 1927-1939. Was a member of the central board for the Swedish Pharmaceutical Association from 1904-1910 and chairman of its southern district from 1907-1915 and a member of the board of directors from 1910-1920. Was a contract delegate for 20 years from 1913 and a member of the pharmacy pension fund from 1909-1939. Was a board member and chairman of the Östergötland district of the Swedish Pharmaceutical Association from 1931-1938 and a member of its executive committee from 1927-1934 and a member and vice chairman of the central board from 1935-1939. Was a member of the pharmacy fee committee from 1928-1935 and was promoted in the pharmacy profession from 1930-1939. Was a member of the city council in Eslöv from 1911-1920 and gave lectures at pharmaceutical meetings. Wrote articles on pharmacy salary and contractual issues. Hobby was collecting modern Swedish art. Received the Order of the Sword.
